abstract: The $162 million deal is the latest effort by G.E. to shrink its massive finance division to refocus on safer industrial lending.
snippet: The $162 million deal is the latest effort by G.E. to shrink its massive finance division to refocus on safer industrial lending.
lead_paragraph: General Electric’s finance unit, GE Capital, agreed on Friday to sell its Mexican consumer mortgage division to Santander of Spain for 2 billion pesos, or $162 million, part of the industrial giant’s strategy to sell off noncore financial assets.

headline.main: G.E. to Sell Mexican Mortgage Unit to Santander

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
